comments: For a summer online class, there is a considerable amount of homework (5 week class with over 50 assignments). Group project for an online course seemed odd to me. The written instructions were different than blackboard instructions. A bit abrupt in her communication, but I get the impression she cares. She does let you know how you can improve.

comments: Professor Gilreath is a great teacher and the course material is fun. She\'s very strict on following the assigned guidelines for particular assignment and if you miss one thing, she will grade you down. I have learned a lot about criticAl thinking and if you\'re up for the challenge take her. The assignments can be a little clearer.

tag_professor: Tough Grader (12)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (9)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (4)  GROUP PROJECTS (3)  Get ready to read (3)  Gives good feedback (1)  TEST HEAVY (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)
comments: Gilreath is a passionate, but poor teacher. For Reading 150, you are supposed to learn critical thinking, and how to reason for yourself, but if it\'s not exactly how she wants it, you\'re wrong! She\'s very unclear about what she wants, and is extremely subjective in her grading. One of my least favorite teachers in my entire schooling EVER.

comments: The first 10 weeks aren\'t bad. Everything is done in groups. Exams are tough & the amount of work the last 2 months is ridiculous. Not clear on assignments AT ALL & will make you feel stupid for asking questions. Class is mostly group discussions about a chapter. Submits major assignment day of final so watch your grade drop 10 % (: do E.C!
